Title: "Advanced Filtering Techniques for Hotel Data in Azure Search"
Text:
C:\Users\adamh\Downloads\azure-search.pdf131577 47.678581)') le 10odata-filter-exprFind all hotels where the "Description" field is null. The field will be null if it was neverset, or if it was explicitly set to null:odata-filter-exprFind all hotels with name equal to either 'Sea View motel' or 'Budget hotel'). Thesephrases contain spaces, and space is a default delimiter.
You can specify an alternativedelimiter in single quotes as the third string parameter:odata-filter-exprFind all hotels with name equal to either 'Sea View motel' or 'Budget hotel' separated by'|'):odata-filter-exprFind all hotels where all rooms have the tag 'wifi' or 'tub':odata-filter-exprFind a match on phrases within a collection, such as 'heated towel racks' or 'hairdryerincluded' in tags.
odata-filter-expr    $filter=geo.intersects(Location, geography'POLYGON((-122.031577 47.578581, -122.031577 47.678581, -122.131577 47.678581, -122.031577 47.578581))')    $filter=Description eq null    $filter=search.in(HotelName, 'Sea View motel,Budget hotel', ',')    $filter=search. in(HotelName, 'Sea View motel|Budget hotel', '|')    $filter=Rooms/any(room: room/Tags/any(tag: search.in(tag, 'wifi, tub')))    $filter=Rooms/any(room: room/Tags/any(tag: search.in(tag, 'heated towel racks,hairdryer included', ','))Find documents with the word "waterfront". This filter query is identical to a searchrequest with search=waterfront.
